free_txt: A.P.T.
EXPERIMENTAL SITE. H.L.
R.W.,S.M.Q.
MAIN REFERENCE.
7 MV VAN DE GRAAFF AT GEEL.
.TRITIUM PRODUCTION BY FAST NEUTRONS ON LI-6 MAY BE
NEGLECTED DUE TO THE HIGH ENRICHMENT OF THE SAMPLE.
THE EFFECT OF EPITHEMAL AND THERMAL NEUTRONS WAS
SHOWN TO BE ALSO NEGLIGIBLE BY IRRADIATING ADDITIONAL
LITHIUM SAMPLES ( ENRICHED TO 95.7 +/- 0.5 PER CENT )
AT THREE NEUTRON ENERGIES - 5.23 6.49 AND 7.73 MEV.
.FOR THE D-D NEUTRON SOURCE, THE FLUX AT THE POSITION
OF THE HYDROGEN RADIATOR WAS CORRECTED FOR THE
TRANSMISSION OF THE SAMPLE. THIS WAS CALULATED FROM
THE LI-7 TOTAL CROSS SECTION, BUT WAS ALSO VERIFIED
EXPERIMENTALLY AT THREE NEUTRON ENERGIES USING A
SPARE LITHIUM SAMPLE.
.DURING SOME OF THE LONG IRRADIATION RUNS THE DATA
ACQUISITION OF THE PROTON RECOIL COUNTER WAS
INTERRUPTED BY ACCIDENT AND THE FLUX DURING THESE
INTERRUPTIONS HAD TO BE CALCULATED FROM THE ION BEAM
CHARGE ASSUMING PROPORTIONALITY BETWEEN CHARGE AND
NEUTRON PRODUCTION.
.FROM THE FLUX AT THE POSITION OF THE RADIATOR FOIL
THE FLUX AVERAGED OVER THE SAMPLE VOLUME WAS
DETERMINED TAKING INTO ACCOUNT THE GEOMETRY AND THE
ANGULAR DISTRIBUTION OF THE SOURCE NEUTRONS.
CORRECTIONS FOR NEUTRON SCATTERING AND ABSORPTION
WITHIN THE SAMPLE WERE PERFORMED.
.THE SPECTRUM OF SECONDARY NEUTRONS WAS DETERMINED
WITH A CALIBRATED NE-213 TOF SPECTROMETER AND WAS
FOUND TO BE CONSISTENT WITH RESULTS WHICH WERE
DEDUCED FROM THE LOW ENERGY TAIL OF THE OBSERVED
PROTON RECOIL SPECTRA. THE EFFECT OF THESE
SECONDARY NEUTRONS ON THE TRITIUM BREEDING CROSS
SECTION IS ESSENTIALLY ZERO BELOW 6.5 MEV PRIMARY
NEUTRON ENERGY AND INCREASES TO ABOUT 3.5 PER CENT
AT 8 MEV.
GAS PROPORTIONAL COUNTER
.THE NEUTRON FLUX WAS MONITORED WITH A PROTON RECOIL
TELESCOPE DESCRIBED IN H.LISKIEN, PROC. SYMP. NEUTRON
STANDARDS AND FLUX NORMALIZATION, ARGONNE PAGE 343
UNCERTAINTY IN INCIDENT NEUTRON ENERGY IS
DUE TO UNCERTAINTIES IN -
DEUTERON ENERGY
TARGET THICKNESS
STOPPING POWER OF TARGET MATERIAL FOR
DEUTERONS
IRRADIATION ANGLE
THE QUOTED ERROR COVERS THE FULL RANGE OF THE
SPECTRUM SEEN BY THE SAMPLE.
TOTAL ERROR ( ONE SIGMA ) OBTAINED BY QUADRATIC
SUMMATION OF THE FOLLOWING CONTRIBUTIONS.
( TYPICAL VALUES FOR THE D-D AND D-T SOURCES
ARE GIVEN IN PER CENT ).
ORIGIN                            D-D       D-
SAMPLE WEIGHT                              0.5       0.
ISOTOPIC SAMPLE COMPOSITION                0.1       0.
EXTERNAL GEOMETRY                          2.9   2.0-2.
EFFECT OF SPURIOUS NEUTRONS            0.1-1.2       0.
SCATTERING WITHIN THE SAMPLE               1.0       1.
INTERNAL TELESCOPE GEOMETRY                1.3       1.
HYDROGEN CONTENTS OF RADIATORS             1.5       1.
PROTON RECOILS                         1.0-3.0       1.
N-P SCATTERING CROSS SECTION           1.0-1.2       2.
SAMPLE TRANSMISSION                        0.5        -
ANGULAR DISTRIBUTION OF SOURCE             0.1       3.
FLUX INTERPOLATION                     0.0-2.6        -
TRITIUM EXTRACTIION                        2.0       2.
CALIBRATION OF TRITIUM COUNTER             3.0       3.
TRITIUM COUNTING                       0.8-4.1       0.
TRITIUM HALF LIFE                          0.2       0.
7 MV VAN DE GRAAFF AT GEEL.
FOR NEUTRON ENERGY RANGE  5 TO  8 MEV
FOR NEUTRON ENERGY RANGE 13 TO 16 MEV.
TITANIUM OCCLUDED TARGETS ON 0.3 MILLI-M SILVER
BACKINGS.
-ABOUT 2 MILLI-G PER CM2 D-TI BOMBARDED BY DEUTERON
CURRENTS OF BETWEEN 8 AND 10 MICRO-AMP.
SAMPLE IRRADIATION TIME VARIED FROM 28 TO 53 HOURS.
-ABOUT 1 MILLI-G PER CM2 T-TI BOMBARDED BY A DEUTERON
CURRENT OF 25 MICRO-AMP.
SAMPLE IRRADIATION TIME 160 HOURS.
TRITIUM EXTRACTED FROM IRRADIATED SAMPLES
AND ITS ACTIVITY DETERMINED.
NEUTRON-PROTON SCATTERING CROSS
SECTION AT 180 DEGREES. DATA TAKEN FROM J.C.HOPKINS
BETA MINUS FROM TRITIUM DECAY.
.LITHIUM ENRICHED IN LI-7 TO 99.99 +/- 0.01 ATOMS
PER CENT. NOMINAL DIMENSIONS- 20 MILLI-M DIAMETER
4 MILLI-M THICK. TYPICAL WEIGHT- 660 MILLI-G WITH A
VARIATION +/- 20 MILLI-G.
.SAMPLES WERE ETCHED WITH METHANOL AND ENCAPSULATED IN
0.25 MILLI-M THICK ALUMINIUM CONTAINER.
.DATA TAKEN FROM MAIN REFERENCE.
.TABLE 1
